text: I'm a sucker for games with style, and if there's one thing Sang-Froid oozes it's style. The fact that the game itself is an extremely compelling weird mix of tower defense, RTS and hack'n'slash doesn't hurt it at all, either.
author: masterplusmargarita

text: J'ai ce jeu depuis pas mal de temps. Il est très sympa, mais assez difficile je trouve. L'ambiance est géniale, en grande partie grâce aux musiques, et aux dialogues, doublés en Québécois avec l'accent, pour un français, c'est juste hilarant ! :D

author: Oztington

text: This is an indie game mixing tower defense with 3rd person action, it's fairly well rated although it has some technical problems. It takes place in 1850s Eastern Canada and it's made by french canadians, so it's only natural there's Quebec folk music. I like to go to a sugar shack at least once a year during winter and there's always this type of music playing live, which is pretty awesome.
author: SupraDarky

text: this song sounds like a celitc jig, its surprising how much the quebec folk music has in common with it.
author: Laughing Man

text: Bah, tout le monde sait que la cabane à sucre est juste une excuse pour boire de la bière l'après-midi. ^__^
author: C_Clop

text:
@C_Clop

Holy fuck, the Translate button works!! It translated exactly what I meant!
author: C_Clop

text: @C_Clop It's because French is so similar to English, and it helps that that sentence was really simple..  "Tout le monde" and "everyone", "just une excuse" and "just an excuse", "apres-midi" and "afternoon", etc. are pretty much 1-1 conversions so it's easy for machine translation to get the job done.  It wouldn't look as nice for Japanese or Chinese.
